image.altText: Co-living by Gallery Group house from their web page.

props.synopsis: With growing demand for share houses, some say co-living could be the alternative â€” but others say it's just a marketing ploy.

title.children: 'A race to the bottom': People are turning to co-living to beat the rental market, but some say it's a slippery slope

image.altText: A man with grey hair dressed in camoflauge gear prepares a drone for flight next to a man staring at a laptop screen.

props.synopsis: Commander Anton is part of an elite squad of Ukrainian soldiers who call themselves the "Peaky Blinders" after the violent British television drama. Here's how they managed to stop Russia's advance after its surprise offensive in May.

title.children: As Ukrainians hold off an offensive from the enemy, the ABC was taken to a secret position near the Russian border

image.altText: A woman with frustrated expression seen looking into laptop screen with blurred kitchen behind her.

props.synopsis: Fake job listings are increasingly used by companies to give the illusion they're thriving and to placate overworked staff. If you're applying for work, there are plenty of clues to look out for to avoid wasting your time.

title.children: Fake job ads waste applicants' time and harm their wellbeing. So why are companies posting them?

image.altText: Two pictures of an old man side by side, in one he holds a baby

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest into the unrelated deaths of three people outside Adelaide emergency departments hears "unrelenting" ramping takes a toll on staff and has caused many to leave.

title.children: Adelaide emergency department chief tells inquest access block causes 'unrelenting' ramping

image.altText: A close up on a fair-skinned woman's hands in fabric work gloves holding a snapped purple sweet potato above red dirt.

props.synopsis: A nutritionist says purple sweet potatoes have higher antioxidants than the more popular gold variety and are a cost-effective food for families.Â

title.children: Colourful varieties of kitchen staple win praise for packing healthy punch

image.altText: A woman and man standing with their hands resting on a greyhound with a trophy in front

props.synopsis: South Australia's peak greyhound racing industry body has handed a life ban and $220,000 fine to a trainer, after its independent Integrity Hearing Panel (IHP) found him guilty of 11 charges relating to animal mistreatment.

title.children: Greyhound trainer handed life ban following ABC investigation

image.altText: A man with a yellow checkered shirt walks outside of court surrounded by female journalists holding microphones.

props.synopsis: South Australia's notorious "bicycle bandit", accused of carrying out armed hold-ups over a decade, has pleaded guilty to 10 counts of aggravated robbery.

title.children: Terminally ill man admits to being 'bicycle bandit' who terrorised victims at gunpoint

image.altText: A softly lit street light.

props.synopsis: Birmingham was once a powerhouse industrial metropolis, but now the UK's second city is a shell of its former self as rubbish lines the streets, the lights stay off and children grow up below the poverty line.

title.children: The UK's second-biggest city is so broke it can no longer keep the lights on

image.altText: White frost covers the grass in Canberra as cows graze

props.synopsis: Eastern Australia will continue to shiver through unusually cold temperatures for the rest of the week, with some capitals facing their coldest morning of the year so far, days out from the winter solstice.Â

title.children: Large parts of Australia stuck in cold snap as shortest day of year nears

image.altText: Li Qiang and Anthony Albanese toast two glasses of wine during a dinner

props.synopsis: Chinese Premier Li Qiang's visit to Australia is strategically timed and full of diplomatic gestures. It could significantly influence Anthony Albanese's upcoming election campaign.

title.children: 'A big gift pack': Chinese premier's visit a boost for Albanese's election campaign

image.altText: A white woman with long blonde hair sitting in a wheelchair in a lounge room

props.synopsis: Ambulatory wheelchair users are relatively common but say they often face judgement and accusations they're faking their disabilities. This is what they want you to know.

title.children: It's not safe for Shae to walk everywhere, but she still gets accosted for using a wheelchair

image.altText: Ian McKellen in a leather jacket holding a glass.

props.synopsis: The 85-year-old was performing in a production of Player Kings when about two hours into the show he fell off the stage.Â

title.children: Ian McKellen rushed to hospital after falling off stage during play

image.altText: Three men wearing black sitting side by side on a table. A blue and white Israeli flag is in the background.

props.synopsis: The Israeli prime minister had disbanded the war cabinet overseeing military decisions in Gaza after the resignation of one of its three members. The move will likely consolidate Benjamin Netanyahu's influence over the conflict.

title.children: Israel's PM has dissolved his war cabinet. What does that mean?

image.altText: Kylian Mbappe

props.synopsis: Kylian MbappÃ© goes down with an injury, while one of the great upsets in Euro history sees 48th-ranked Slovakia down a world giant. Here are the five quick hits from Euro 2024 overnight.

title.children: Five quick hits: French star injured, two massive upsets, and a YouTuber sneaks into Euro opening ceremony

image.altText: Australian Securities Exchange

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank is likely to keep interest rates on hold at a 12-year high, and the Australian share market has risen after a record-breaking session on Wall Street. Follow live.

title.children: ASX rises ahead of Reserve Bank's interest rate decision, S&P 500 hits record high

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Lithium, banking and healthcare stocks drive ASX higher
ASX opens higher, led by financials and property sectors
NSW Treasurer Daniel Mookhey set to hand down budget forecasting years of deficits

image.altText: Surface scum in the Murray River from the blue green algae outbreak in April 2016.

props.synopsis: The River Murray is expected to emit an unpleasant odour this week but experts say it has been years since they have seen it so healthy.

title.children: River stink no cause for alarm as ecosystem strengthens to bring exciting new life

image.altText: A merino ewe with her six marked lambs

props.synopsis: Ian Rowett's sheep stud at Marrabel is the second farm in South Australia to have recorded a sextuplet lamb birth this year, an event vets say is "incredibly rare".

title.children: Farmer shocked after 'amazing' merino ewe gives birth to six lambs

image.altText: Dozens of people stand in a line on a steep hill with a large flat-top mountain in the distance

props.synopsis: Time is running out in South Africa to find solutions to its real-world problems â€” otherwise the country may well become another textbook case on what happens when inequality is allowed to fester.

title.children: South Africa's future depends on an 'unholy alliance' solving its real-world problems before time runs out

image.altText: Swimmig Cody Walker reaching for the railing to get out of a swimming pool, holding his cap and goggles

props.synopsis: After failing to make the Australian Olympic swimming team for the Paris Games, Cody Simpson says he can resume his music career knowing he gave everything he had in the pool.

title.children: Cody Simpson set to resume music career after giving everything in pursuit of Olympic dream

image.altText: A drone shot of a warehouse block

props.synopsis: Asset group Dexus is appealing the Brisbane council's approval of a 15-storey precinct with apartments and shops in order to protect its own profits, a major developer claims.

title.children: Why a Sydney landlord is attempting to block a Brisbane housing and retail development

image.altText: A snapshot from a police officer's body cam shows hands reaching for a small, pink piglet on a road.

props.synopsis: A pet piglet has surprised police in Northern California with its speed and strength during a frantic chase through town.Â

title.children: Pickles the pig leads Californian police on frantic chase

image.altText: Sign for the rehabilitation unit

props.synopsis: The report, based out of the United States, mirrors recent reporting by Australian researchers.Â

title.children: One in five people diagnosed with COVID-19 fail to recover months after infection, new study finds

image.altText: The crutch of the statue of David, with an eggplant emoji over his genitals. A tourist with binoculars looks on

props.synopsis: The world's most famous classicist helps unpack the mystery behind statue penis-size and shares her theory on why so many men are obsessed with the Roman Empire.

title.children: 'It's the $64,000 question': Why do ancient statues have such teeny-tiny penises?

image.altText: NSW Premier Chris Minns stands in front of two essential workers at a press announcement about housing for these workers

props.synopsis: The state government forecasts four years of deficits after a change to how money from the GST is distributed, but has made funding for affordable housing the centrepiece of its budget.

title.children: 'Dudded by an absurd system': Surplus hopes dashed by GST blow, NSW treasurer says

image.altText: A middle-aged woman wearing spectacles sits in an office, speaking to another woman.

props.synopsis: Lawyers say the government should offer student debt relief to legal professionals willing to work outside metropolitan areas, where people are struggling to get the representation they are entitled to.

title.children: Clogged courts and self-representation as bush lawyer shortage hits crisis point

image.altText: An Australian $100  note is seen with Australian flag behind

props.synopsis: More than 100 Australians earned more than $1 million yet paid no tax in 2021â€“22, while Australia's highest earners live in Double Bay, according to newly released data from the Australian Taxation Office.

title.children: Millionaires who paid no tax and the richest and poorest postcodes and occupations revealed

image.altText: Melbourne chiropractor Ian Rossborough cracks a baby's back

props.synopsis: The Chiropractic Board of Australia has reinstated an interim ban on the spinal manipulation of children under the age of two following a request from federal and state health ministers.

title.children: Ban on chiropractors manipulating the spines of babies reinstated following outcry from doctors

image.altText: Bec Bulley has her hands in her pockets and looks glum, Sam Wallace-Joseph holds the ball with one hand and waves the other

props.synopsis: In a wild week of netball headlines, the NSW Swifts parted ways with their star shooter on the same night that the Queensland Firebirds sent their head coach packing. Now there are questions about who will take their places with just four rounds of Super Netball to go.

title.children: 'It's unprecedented': Two big names depart Super Netball on same night, sending fan speculation into overdrive

image.altText: Chinese Premier Li Qiang meets Anthony Albanese

props.synopsis: Australians are being offered visa-free entry to China for visits lasting up to 15 days, as Prime Minister Anthony Albanese declares relations between both nations have been "renewed and revitalised".

title.children: Beijing offers visa-free entry to Australians with defence talks flagged to avoid military clashes

image.altText: A group of six police officers on motorcycles lined up behind a police car.

props.synopsis: Chinese Premier Li Qiang was only in Canberra for around 24 hours, but behind the scenes the security arrangements for his visit took months to plan and involved hundreds of police officers from across the capital.

title.children: Behind the scenes of the Chinese premier's visit to Canberra was months of planning and hundreds of police officers

image.altText: A line drawing of a woman cradling a baby with a hospital bed behind.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian mothers have been speaking out on their birth experiences as part of a parliamentary inquiry investigating maternity services in the state.

title.children: Claire planned to have a large family, but a birth injury left her infertile. Hers is one of the stories before an inquiry

image.altText: A court sketch of an Indian man.

props.synopsis: US federal prosecutors accuse Nikhil Gupta of plotting with an Indian government official to kill Gurpatwant Singh Pannun, a US resident who advocates for a sovereign Sikh state in northern India.

title.children: Indian man pleads not guilty to Sikh assassination plot in New York

image.altText: Plane engine on fire in the sky.

props.synopsis: A Virgin Australia plane bound for Melbourne has safely landed in New Zealand after an engine caught fire shortly after take-off.Â

title.children: Virgin Australia plane makes emergency landing after engine fire

image.altText: A young Indigenous woman wearing a child's nightie sits holding a doll. Her face is bruised.

props.synopsis: Stolen is based on the real-life experiences of members of the Stolen Generations. Its message is as relevant now as when the play was first written nearly three decades ago.

title.children: 22,000 First Nations kids are in out-of-home care today. That's why this 90s play is still relevant
